{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3353845,"name":"","username":"LHACK4142","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lhack4142/{size}/196107_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T06:05:23.094Z","cooked":"

We just qualled for Worlds, and I want to take advantage of this to keep working on cool programming features as one of the coders.

Shooting (esp. automatic firing, so the robot shoots the shot right when it becomes viable) on the move seems like it’d save a great deal of time- simply driving by the speaker as opposed to coming to a stop and lining up feels like it’d help our cycle times a lot.

However, I don’t know how much time, iteration, and testing (which ofc detracts from drive practice time) this would take. Does anyone have insights on how viable + beneficial this is to develop and get working by Worlds? And what methods worked (I’m considering just vector math and uber simple physics, but not sure that’s enough considering many teams use LUTs for even just stationary shots)?

Thank you!!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T06:05:36.108Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":29,"reads":329,"readers_count":328,"score":245.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461524,"topic_slug":"shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58301,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"coder in the corner"},"post_url":"/t/shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how/461524/1","custom_user_title":"coder in the corner","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3353847,"name":"Tal Donde","username":"dondet","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dondet/{size}/215320_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T06:31:18.441Z","cooked":"

If your shooter yaw targeting angle PID currently uses your robot position and vector math, you can add your velocity vector * arbitrary tuned value to your robot position vector, which essentially is a rough way of predicting the robot position when the shot takes place.

Can’t say whether it’s worthwhile, probably depends on whether you have the time to implement it.

This is what Rembrandts used in one of their OA threads.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T06:31:54.563Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":307,"readers_count":306,"score":96.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461524,"topic_slug":"shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how","display_username":"Tal Donde","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31634,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how/461524/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353850,"name":"","username":"LHACK4142","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lhack4142/{size}/196107_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T06:35:00.287Z","cooked":"

Don’t we want to predict the relative position between the robot and the speaker when the shot lands? How does knowing the robot position when the shot takes place help, and don’t we know that already from localization?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T06:35:00.287Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":304,"readers_count":303,"score":65.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461524,"topic_slug":"shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":31634,"username":"dondet","name":"Tal Donde","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dondet/{size}/215320_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58301,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"coder in the corner"},"post_url":"/t/shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how/461524/3","custom_user_title":"coder in the corner","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353853,"name":"Tal Donde","username":"dondet","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dondet/{size}/215320_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T06:41:08.465Z","cooked":"
LHACK4142:

Don’t we want to predict the relative position between the robot and the speaker when the shot lands?

Yes but this is very dynamic, it will be tough to implement. Sounds like something Orbit did in 2022 (check their behind the bumpers).
With the suggested method the note will be scored if the speed of the robot is sufficiently low.

LHACK4142:

How does knowing the robot position when the shot takes place help, and don’t we know that already from localization?

Because you are accounting for the delay of the driver pressing the shoot button and the note actually leaving the robot.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T06:41:08.465Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":294,"readers_count":293,"score":63.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461524,"topic_slug":"shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how","display_username":"Tal Donde","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31634,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how/461524/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353854,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T07:03:29.613Z","cooked":"

You can also just use the velocity of the robot and subtract that from the note velocity vector to figure out if you can make a shot or not. Make sure your robot speed is very constant to avoid accelerating as the note moves into the shooter.

If you have extra time, maybe focusing on better autonomous routines or strategic driver practice would be good as well.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T07:03:47.284Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":262,"readers_count":261,"score":67.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":461524,"topic_slug":"shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how/461524/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353859,"name":"","username":"LHACK4142","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lhack4142/{size}/196107_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T07:26:03.295Z","cooked":"
Tal Donde:

Sounds like something Orbit did in 2022 (check their behind the bumpers).

After watching- wow. Are teams this year using a similar approach? If so, what do they model to find a good shot? I’m wondering how deep we need to go- do we need to consider gravity (with andymark 4" compliants at 6000rpm)? air resistance? If air resistance, how do we find the drag coefficient?

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T07:26:03.295Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":64.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":461524,"topic_slug":"shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58301,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"coder in the corner"},"post_url":"/t/shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how/461524/6","custom_user_title":"coder in the corner","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353862,"name":"Tal Donde","username":"dondet","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dondet/{size}/215320_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T07:31:57.140Z","cooked":"

The depth that Orbit goes to is nowhere near what many other teams will consider.
The only good way to discover the answer to your questions you are asking is through empirical testing.
I would suggest the Rembrandts method as it seemed to work well for them.

Rembrandts shooting on the move

Rembrandts thread post

4481 Team Rembrandts | 2024 Build Thread | Open Alliance","clicks":29}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":58301,"username":"LHACK4142","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lhack4142/{size}/196107_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31634,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how/461524/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353869,"name":"Bailey Bonde","username":"bcb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bcb/{size}/176456_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T08:30:32.361Z","cooked":"

I mean, my team was trying this out today, and the main worry for us is that shooting on the go (we have a fixed intake) just poses too many possible outside factors that can affect the shot no matter how much physics we do. For us it only saves like .1 s, so we’ve found that it’s just more worth it to come to a stop, or at the very least, slow down dramatically.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T08:30:32.361Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":200,"readers_count":199,"score":45.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461524,"topic_slug":"shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how","display_username":"Bailey Bonde","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53750,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"former 7525 controls lead"},"post_url":"/t/shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how/461524/8","custom_user_title":"former 7525 controls lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353876,"name":"SndMndBdy","username":"SndMndBdy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T10:32:12.435Z","cooked":"

My team implemented shooting on the move this season, and got it to work very accurately. Unfortunately, in real matches, we basically never get the opportunity to use it. It requires a clear path of driving by the speaker so that no one bumps into you while shooting, or that you don’t have to make any last-minute movements while the shot is coming out of your robot.

It seems that in just about every cycle, there are robots that are sitting in front of the speaker blocking a clear moving path through there. So we end up stopping and doing a stationary shot-aim instead.

So, if you have other value-add things you could be doing with your time between now and championships, you might want to prioritize those higher.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T10:32:12.435Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":178,"readers_count":177,"score":80.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":461524,"topic_slug":"shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how","display_username":"SndMndBdy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53750,"username":"bcb","name":"Bailey Bonde","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bcb/{size}/176456_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20008,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/shooting-on-the-move-should-we-do-it-and-if-so-how/461524/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353878,"name":"Nigel","username":"Nigelientje","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nigelientje/{size}/209408_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T10:51:42.611Z","cooked":"

Since I see our thread linked here, I thought I’d give my 2 cents as well.

LHACK4142:

However, I don’t know how much time, iteration, and testing (which ofc detracts from drive practice time) this would take.

This heavily depends on how complex you want your implementation, and more importantly, what the goal should be. In our case, the added complexity of being able to shoot (and score) at full speed wasn’t worth it. We mostly use it to not have to come to a complete stop before shooting.

So from my POV, the 2 most important things to ask yourself are:

  1. At what velocity do I want to score?
  2. From which distance?

Higher velocity requires better approximations and longer distance requires better accuracy.

Regardless of these values, the most important word here is approximation. Both simple vector math/physics and our implementation can be viable at the same time, as long as they both produce a result within the parameters you determined above.
(discussion about simplicity vs mathematical accuracy for reference)

LHACK4142:

Does anyone have insights on how viable + beneficial this is to develop and get working by Worlds?

I think shooting on the move can be a really interesting project to work on, but seeing as you only have a week left, I don’t know if I would call it viable.

From experience, 99% of the time it is better to do extra driver practice than to develop new features last minute if your ultimate goal is reducing cycle time.
